result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Edward Lucas

defendant.name: Lucas, Andrew Edward
defendant.address: 5353 Wensaut Lane, c/o Randy Daniels, Crandon, WI 54520

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol, upon request from law enforcement, defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine presence of alcohol or drugs.

10:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Edward Lucas in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Andrew Edward Lucas. Court calls 22CF89, 22TR147, 22TR146 and 22TR149. State - here for PH on CF case and STC on Traffic matters. Lucas and Halyburton agree. Court has waiver of right to PH form, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed the Information. Halyburton has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts, set for JT. Court accepts pleas, sets for JT, traffic matters will track. Halyburton want to be heard on bond. Court allows. Halyburton - bond - asking for high signature bond for stated reasons with same conditions. State - bond - no objection to a bond reduction but states concern with future appearances - asking for some cash, $500.00 cash. Court - bond - will modify bond to a $3000.00 signature bond - no consumption of alcohol, upon request from law enforcement, defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine presence of alcohol or drugs.

No consumption of alcohol, upon request from law enforcement, defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine presence of alcohol or drugs, defendant must turn himself into FOSO if he is no longer able to reside at 5353 Wensaut Lane with Randy Daniels until a new address is provided.

11:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Edward Lucas appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Andrew Edward Lucas. Lucas and Halyburton have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH within time limits. Court will set for PH on 5/23/22 at 10:00 AM. Halyburton would like to be heard on bond - asking for a reduction to $1000.00 cash bond for stated reasons, will be living with his Uncle Ray Daniels in Stone Lake if bond reduction is given. Defendant has talked to his Aunt and Uncle and confirmed their address for the record. State - bond - no objection to $1,000.00 cash bond with the conditions to continue. Court - bond - will reduce bond to $1,000.00 cash with same conditions plus an additional condition that he must reside with Randy Daniels at 5353 Wensaut Lane, Crandon, WI and if he can't, he must turn himself in until a new address is provided.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew Edward Lucas
Current: 5353 Wensaut Lane, c/o Randy Daniels, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2022)
Prior: 1227 S Lafayette St, Shawano, WI 54166
Adjourned initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.

09:49 AM Defendant Andrew Edward Lucas appears by video from FC jail with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton appearing in person.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Halyburton indicates she just received complaint, has to do a conflict check and asks for AIA. Lucas has not received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Lucas understands. State asks for bond to remain at this time. Court will continue bond at this point.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
No consumption of alcohol. Upon request of law enforcement must provide evidentiary sample of breath or blood to determine level of alcohol drugs
